reviewText: Saludos! Me ratifico en el título de esta "review" muy buen dvd, atractiva presentación, excelente el concierto y las entrevistas pero tiene un pequeño problema que se esta volviendo una mala costumbre de algunas compañias discográficas: falta el videoclip y su making off de "Goodbye my lover" que si estaba incluido en otra edición (cd+dvd) de este mismo álbum.Al parecer para determinadas zonas o ediciones cambian los contenidos de los productos lo que me parece una gran injusticia y desilusión ya que lo justo es que sea LO MISMO PARA TODOS.
summary: Casi perfecto!!! Si no fuera por un pequeño problema...
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the best DVD I've bought in years.  The BBC Concert footage is even better than the "Back to Bedlam" CD, which I've already worn out.  Seeing James Blunt perform the fantastic songs he's written is even better than just listening!  He has it all:  great songwriting, mesmerizing performances, and a personality both intelligent and charming.  The extras on the DVD -- the videos, making-of-videos, interviews with James -- are just great!  The DVD is worth double what it cost.

reviewText: I love this dvd!  My favorite song is wisemen.  Some things I don't understand like the three guys dressed up in faces just like James Blunt?  I'll admit though it was refreshing to see a different stage set up other than just an amp and a guitar.

reviewText: Welcome James Blunt!  Those of us who love lyrics..moving, emotional, inspiring and thought provoking lyrics welcome James Blunt into our lives.  We've missed you!  Never since John Lennon have I felt such emotion listing to a song.  I mean ALL of his songs.  There isn't one song in which I haven't connected with and loved hearing over and over again.  Finally music with soul.  Music with real meaning.  My meaning being different from his or yours, but meaning none the less.  FINALLY! This video also gives us a small glimpse into the very funky personality of James Blunt.P.S.I'm in my earyl 40's and my daughter 17...She loves this music just as much!
Title: N/A

reviewText: James Blunt is an artist who can evoke more emotion by lifting one eyebrow than most performers can by gyrating their entire bodies and breaking down into hysterical fits of crying. We see this here, gratefully, in the short but sweet 45 minute concert.We are also treated to seeing the videos, the making of the videos, and two interviews, both of which were gratifying - perhaps most because in one of them we saw what he looked like completely clean shaven in his army uniform, with short hair parted to the side. Very different look.His favorite song is "Goodbye My Lover", and it's mine too. When I first saw him perform it on Saturday Night Live, it felt like I was saying good-bye to *my* lover, and the harrowing vocals at the end (I'm so hollow...) put my heart in my throat. At the time, I didn't think I had ever heard an artist display so much emotion with only a piano, a voice, and facial expressions. If there was an Oscar or Grammy for such a thing, he'd get it. That song is what spurred me to buy his CD. I have since seen him perform that song on Oprah, and now on this DVD, and the raw emotion I saw months and months ago is still there. I swear that you can see hints of water in his eyes, like it's still a difficult song for him to sing. Which is amazing, because whether or not that view is correct, that's what it looks like. He's still able to pour that much emotion into a song that he's performed hundreds and hundreds of times.When watching this last night, I forgot how much I enjoyed his CD. I certainly remember now, and the darn thing has me wetting my lips for the follow-up album.

reviewText: This DVD features James Blunt live in concert with his tight knit band of terrific performers backing him up to to a T.  They perform the songs to his masterful album, The Bedlam Sessions, in a top notch way.  There are also bonus features to enjoy whereas Mr. Blunt talks about the making of this solid album.  Highly recommended...I love it!!!
summary: James Blunt - Chasing Time: The Bedlam Sessions

reviewText: Truth be told, I hadn't really known James's work before I saw this show, just a couple of singles. So, for me, it was the first time I had the chance to really see what his music was all about.I immediately connected with his sound, and the powerfully moving lyrics of his songs. I admire an artist that really seems to be involved with the songs and the performances. Blunt really seems to give the best of himself every single time, I came to realize.And then, I became a fan. Bought both deluxe editions of his albums 'Back to Bedlam' and 'All the Lost Souls', and keep listening to them on my MP4 player quite often.Looking forward to going to his concert with Elton John here in Rio de Janeiro!Highly recommended.
Title: N/A
